intro: Ouratea affinis, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers bloom in clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in tropical ecosystems.
